title.narrative: DATA, RESEARCH, EVALUATION AND ANALYSIS

description.narrative: National and local authorities, independent institutions and CSOs are effectively informed and influenced by data, research, evaluation and analysis that enable them to develop, implement, monitor and advocate for national policies, programmes and budgets, in compliance with CRC recommendations and in line with national priorities, SDGs and the process of accession to EU., which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation (Covid), Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Evaluation, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Reducing Child Poverty, Reducing Child Poverty (Covid), Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children and adolescents, particularly the most marginalized, progressively benefit from inclusive national and municipal government policies, budgets and programmes that are evidence-based and which prioritise the best interest of children and youth in public finance and public spending.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National and local authorities, independent institutions and CSOs are effectively informed and influenced by data, research,evaluation and analysis that enable them to develop, implement, monitor and advocate for national policies, programmes and budgets,in compliance with CRC recommendations and in line with national priorities, SDGs and the process of accession to EU.

description.narrative: Independent institutions and civil society organizations for children were supported by UNICEF to reflect on the most pressing issues children face in Serbia as a result of the protracted crisis caused by the COVID-19 pandemic on child rights, particularly of the most vulnerable and discriminated children, as well as problems that affect the achievement of child rights and equity over the long term. UNICEF continued to provide critical and timely data and evidence on the situation of children and started addressing awareness around air pollution among children in 15 local self-governments. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:05/01/2022
